column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=The office of the President of Israel in JerusalemImage : David Shankbone .
#Text=DS : Do you hope to have another term as president ?
#Text=SP
#Text=: Oh , maybe next time I shall go and be a shepherd or a poet .
#Text=Why go back to government ? [ Laughs ]
#Text=DS : [ Laughs ]
#Text=I think you are already seen as both of those things .
#Text=SP
#Text=: Yes , I ’m not orthodox about it and I ’m not particular .
#Text=You know , once I was free of administration , I discovered the great advantage of being free .
#Text=And I feel free .
#Text=Most of my life , I was quite controversial . [ Laughs ]
#Text=Now I know I am tremendously popular .
#Text=I do n’t know what is better , to be controversial and fight or to be popular and becoming a little bit …
#Text=DS : It is unique that when you look at your standing 20 years ago versus now , it ’s so different --
#Text=SP
#Text=: When was better ? [ Laughs ]
#Text=DS : [ Laughs ] Well ...
#Text=SP
#Text=: I think 20 years ago when I was fighting .
#Text=What do you need popularity ?
#Text=Popularity is like perfume : nice to smell , dangerous to drink .
#Text=You do n’t drink it .
#Text=Why are people against you ?
#Text=Because you are against the status quo .
#Text=Why was I unpopular ? I did n’t commit any crime in my life .
#Text=The only crime I committed was to be a little bit ahead of time .
#Text=And if this is the reason for being controversial , maybe the reason is better than the result .
#Text=DS : What do you look at as your greatest legacy in your career ?
#Text=SP
#Text=: I am bored by it .
#Text=My greatest legacy ...
#Text=DS : What pops into your head right away when I asked that ? [ Laughs ]
#Text=SP
#Text=: [ Laughs ]
#Text=It is what I ’m going to do tomorrow .
#Text=What I did yesterday , for me it ’s boring and I ’m very careful not to talk to my children about it because they will be bored .
#Text=So why should I ?
#Text=My mind is set to see what will happen tomorrow .
#Text=DS : You do n’t speak to your children about the things you ’ve done in you life or your grandchildren ?
#Text=SP
#Text=: No I learn from them what they are doing .
#Text=Why should I bore them ?
#Text=They know more about the computers and the internet and all ; I am taking advantage .
#Text=DS : They probably know Wikipedia .
#Text=SP
#Text=: My children are my parents because they teach me the future .
#Text=Traditionally , I should have taught them , but I think it ’s a waste of time .
#Text=Why should I ?
#Text=Why should I load their minds with what I may think are heroic stories ?
#Text=They have their own heroism which is now giving birth to new possibilities , to a new age .
#Text=So my time ? They do n’t ask and I do n’t bother them .
#Text=I imagine they know because [ the press writes ] about me negatively so much , that they can not escape .
#Text=[ Laughs ]
#Text=But they know one thing : I do n’t complain .
#Text=I generally never complain .
#Text=They know we have an honest life .
#Text=So whatever people are writing they do not care , because they know the truth .
